intro: Crotalaria intermedia var. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with trifoliate leaves and yellow or orange flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid to semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a potential resource for medicinal or agricultural use.
